segment.source: Split a Windows image file (.wim) to span across multiple DVDs
segment.target: Split a Windows image file (.wim) to span across multiple DVDs

segment.source: Split a Windows image file (.wim) to span across multiple DVDs
segment.target: Split a Windows image file (.wim) to span across multiple DVDs

segment.source: Split a Windows image file (.wim) to span across multiple DVDs
segment.target: Split a Windows image file (.wim) to span across multiple DVDs

segment.source: Split .wim files into .swm files for DVDs or FAT32 file systems.
segment.target: Split .wim files into .swm files for DVDs or FAT32 file systems.

segment.source: Use this procedure when the split .swm files do not fit in into a single medium, such as these cases:
segment.target: Use this procedure when the split .swm files do not fit in into a single medium, such as these cases:

segment.source: Deploying Windows using DVDs.
segment.target: Deploying Windows using DVDs.

segment.source: (A standard single-sided DVD stores 4.7GB).
segment.target: (A standard single-sided DVD stores 4.7GB).

segment.source: Deploying your Windows image from a Windows PE USB key.
segment.target: Deploying your Windows image from a Windows PE USB key.

segment.source: (The standard Windows PE installation uses the FAT32 file system, which has a maximum file size of 4GB.) For more information, see WinPE: Store or split images to deploy Windows using a single USB key.
segment.target: (The standard Windows PE installation uses the FAT32 file system, which has a maximum file size of 4GB.) For more information, see WinPE: Store or split images to deploy Windows using a single USB key.

segment.source: After the files are split, you can copy them onto separate DVDs, or onto USB key(s).
segment.target: After the files are split, you can copy them onto separate DVDs, or onto USB key(s).

segment.source: Note, before you can apply the image, you must first put all of the split files into the same folder, for example, by copying them to a temporary folder on the destination computer.
segment.target: Note, before you can apply the image, you must first put all of the split files into the same folder, for example, by copying them to a temporary folder on the destination computer.

segment.source: Then use DISM to apply the image, while specifying the split .swm files location and file pattern.
segment.target: Then use DISM to apply the image, while specifying the split .swm files location and file pattern.

segment.source: DISM does not support applying the files from separate folders or DVDs.
segment.target: DISM does not support applying the files from separate folders or DVDs.

segment.source: By default, this option creates new split .wim files with a .swm extension.
segment.target: By default, this option creates new split .wim files with a .swm extension.

segment.source: The first file name is based on the specified file name, and each of the following files receives a number after it.
segment.target: The first file name is based on the specified file name, and each of the following files receives a number after it.

segment.source: For example, when you split "Install.wim", the default filenames are "Install.swm", "Install2.swm", "Install3.swm", and so on.
segment.target: For example, when you split "Install.wim", the default filenames are "Install.swm", "Install2.swm", "Install3.swm", and so on.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Windows Setup doesn't support installing from a split .swm file for Windows 10.
segment.target: Windows Setup doesn't support installing from a split .swm file for Windows 10.

segment.source: You cannot modify a split .swm file.
segment.target: You cannot modify a split .swm file.

segment.source: Scenario: Deploy Windows using DVDs
segment.target: Scenario: Deploy Windows using DVDs

segment.source: On your technician PC, open the Deployment and Imaging Tools Environment as an administrator.
segment.target: On your technician PC, open the Deployment and Imaging Tools Environment as an administrator.

segment.source: Split the Windows image:
segment.target: Split the Windows image:

segment.source: where:
segment.target: where:

segment.source: is the name and the location of the image file that you want to split.
segment.target: is the name and the location of the image file that you want to split.

segment.source: is the destination name and the location for the split .swm files.
segment.target: is the destination name and the location for the split .swm files.

segment.source: is the maximum size in MB for each of the split .swm files to be created.
segment.target: is the maximum size in MB for each of the split .swm files to be created.

segment.source: In this example, the /split option creates an install.swm file, an install2.swm file, an install3.swm file, and so on, in the C:images directory.
segment.target: In this example, the /split option creates an install.swm file, an install2.swm file, an install3.swm file, and so on, in the C:images directory.

segment.source: Copy the files to individual DVDs.
segment.target: Copy the files to individual DVDs.

segment.source: For example, insert the first DVD and type:
segment.target: For example, insert the first DVD and type:

segment.source: Then insert the second DVD and type:
segment.target: Then insert the second DVD and type:

segment.source: And so on until all .swm files are copied to DVDs.
segment.target: And so on until all .swm files are copied to DVDs.

segment.source: Boot your destination computer to Windows Preinstallation Environment (WinPE).
segment.target: Boot your destination computer to Windows Preinstallation Environment (WinPE).

segment.source: For more information, see WinPE: Create a Boot CD, DVD, ISO, or VHD.
segment.target: For more information, see WinPE: Create a Boot CD, DVD, ISO, or VHD.

segment.source: Configure and format your hard drive partitions, as shown in Capture and Apply Windows, System, and Recovery Partitions.
segment.target: Configure and format your hard drive partitions, as shown in Capture and Apply Windows, System, and Recovery Partitions.

segment.source: Copy the files to a single temporary folder.
segment.target: Copy the files to a single temporary folder.

segment.source: For example, insert the first DVD and type:
segment.target: For example, insert the first DVD and type:

segment.source: Then insert the second DVD and type:
segment.target: Then insert the second DVD and type:

segment.source: And so on until all .swm files are copied.
segment.target: And so on until all .swm files are copied.

segment.source: Apply your image using the DISM /Apply-image /swmfile option:
segment.target: Apply your image using the DISM /Apply-image /swmfile option:

segment.target: Remove the temp folder:

segment.source: Set up your system and recovery partitions, as shown in Capture and Apply Windows, System, and Recovery Partitions.
segment.target: Set up your system and recovery partitions, as shown in Capture and Apply Windows, System, and Recovery Partitions.
